Pat Farrell wrote:

> A much more serious problem that I see is that none of the web apps that 
> I've written have a main().

In Java, you can easily configure a servlet so that it automatically 
gets initialized when the web application starts. So it's not too hard 
to come up with a "main()".

> When you want to check something with a lot of state, say the list of 
> current users logged in, you need to access the OneTrueKnowledge.
> Whether the OneTrueKnowledge class is a singleton itself, or is accessed 
> though a singleton factory, its isomorphic.

And both aren't the best option available, or so it seems to me.

The application context might be a good place to store such objects. 
That's what it's made for, isn't it?

Cheers, Ilja
